repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Developing/troubleshooting plugins has some friction because "restarting" Nvim requires quitting, then manually starting again, in some fashion.

Implement a ":restart" command which:
- the UI client stops the `nvim --embed` server.
- the UI client starts  a new `nvim --embed` server and attaches to it.

Fixes: #32484

comment_data.body: I wonder if these checks are even needed because we don't use the Channel that we get from these anywhere else.
Should also see if these are required.
Change argc's type to be size_t instead (?)

comment_data.body: I don't think this is necessary. Because we close the channel using ui_client_channel_id.
This is handled on the client side, not the server side, so it's not an API, but a client method, and there should be in ui_client.c and shouldn't be named like an API.
That makes sense I'll do that.
Actually wait, I'm not sure about the naming part, since there doesn't seem to be a previous example of naming a builtin client method before. Or it should just be a UI event...?
I initially named it `nvim_ui_restart` in ui_client.c but then that didn't make sense for what it was doing so i refactored it into vim.c.
if there is no need for this to be blocking, this should be an ui event. otherwise we need to come up with a new naming scheme for blocking ui requests..

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/33953/files#diff-20672b5afb64a6766aa4c111d6b4f14dbf4606bbb659032ef949f49adec3c687R346 does this make it blocking? If so, i was wondering if there is an alternative to doing this.
No, non-blocking UI events are processed by the client immediately as well. What makes it blocking is that you are invoking it using `rpc_send_call()` on the server.
Ohh okay... Lemme look at this then, thank you!
Replaced this call with `rpc_send_event` instead which is async and made the function `FUNC_API_FAST`. I also did the refactor :D

That's not a UI event. To add a UI event you:
- Add a function prototype e.g. `restart()` to src/nvim/ui_events.in.h with `FUNC_API_CLIENT_IMPL` attribute
- On the server, send the event using `ui_call_restart()`
- Add a `ui_client_event_restart()` to src/nvim/ui_client.c
Done!
Change this to be `assert(argc > 0)` instead. `argc` can never be zero
Unused argument `Array args` can specify `void` instead
Template requires it to be passed in.
any reason this is in the middle of the grid_ events? if not, should probably go after the `error_exit` event near the bottom.

off-topic / non-blocker:: imo this is an uninteresting use of "!" (although common). Users can always do `:wall` to save everything before restart. And `:confirm restart` to opt-in to confirm "unsaved changes".

We might want to use "!" to mean "don't restore state/session" or something like that.

Don't need to figure this out right now.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -66,6 +66,19 @@ Stop or detach the current UI
 
                 Note: Not supported on Windows, currently.
 
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+Restart the embedded Nvim server
+
+                                                *:restart*
+:restart
+                Detaches the embedded server from the UI and then restarts
+                it. This fails when changes have been made
+                and Vim refuses to |abandon| the current buffer.
+
+:restart!

comment_data.body:
We probably need to mention "This only works if the UI started the server initially." 

If the UI connected to some random remote endpoint, that is out of scope for now. We could think about how to support it if anyone shows interest.

FUTURE: we might want to give more control over how the server is stopped. E.g.:

    :restart +qall

(similar to `:help +cmd`). This also frees up "!" to be used for some other purpose.
Done!
Done!

comment_data.body: TODO: Need to figure out why `:restart` and `:detach` don't work on Windows.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -164,6 +164,90 @@ if t.skip(is_os('win')) then
   return
 end
 
+describe('TUI :restart', function()

comment_data.body:
This presumably sends the event to all UIs. But we should only send to the "current UI".  See `ex_detach` for how to get the current UI.

Also, should the server explicitly detach all other UIs?
At most one UI can restart the server
Can the UI event reach multiple UIs? If so, how will each UI know whether to attempt restart?
A UI knows whether it is the one that started the server in the first place. Only that UI can stop the server and then restart it. Other UIs can't stop the server at all.
Will `ui_client_event_restart` be invoked on each UI? If so, we're depending on `channel_close(ui_client_channel_id,...)` to fail I guess?

Before this gets into a larger release (or backported), would it make sense to say a bit more here? Just speaking for myself, I'm not sure that I would have picked up what this means for plugin development and use right away.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -224,6 +224,8 @@ UI
 • Error messages are more concise:
   • "Error detected while processing:" changed to "Error in:".
   • "Error executing Lua:" changed to "Lua:".
+• |:restart| detaches the embedded server from the UI and then restarts
+  it.

comment_data.body: I have the same comment here that I do on news.txt: this should be slightly more verbose. Users may not see what this means based on the current help text.

comment_data.body:
For this, I'm thinking along the lines of:
If the custom command argument is passed we make a `rpc_send_event` to the server to call `nvim_command` and then proceed with the `ui_client_detach` and `channel_close` (I wonder if these two are required if the command actually quits, might have to experiment a little bit).
Should also think about what to do if the command being passed doesn't actually quit the server.

Will make a draft PR working on the follow-ups from this PR soon..

comment_regular_data.body:
TODO:
1. ~Fix failing tests (overflow in argc + 1, File size errors uncrustify) [maybe running `make format` first might fix uncrustify errors, idk why I didn't think of that immediately 😭]~ Done

2. ~Add unit tests to test `nvim_restart()` and add integration tests to test ":restart". [Figure out if config changes need to be tested in integration tests.]~ Done [config changes seem untestable, would need advice on it from maintainers]

3. ~Figure out how nvim_restart can be added to the lua API as `vim.api.nvim_restart()`.~ Realized that it is supposed to be remote only so no lua API.

4. ~Figure out why functionaltests are failing with `EOF was received from Nvim. Likely the Nvim process crashed. stderr:
nvim: .../ui.c:0: void ui_flush(void): Assertion '!ui_client_channel_id' failed.
AddressSanitizer:DEADLYSIGNAL`~ Done - removed the test as it was buggy

5. ~See if we need to handle unsaved buffers and dissallow ":restart" if there are unsaved buffers. If so, we can make ":restart!" force quit all buffers even if they are unsaved.~ Done - it also respects `autowriteall`

6. ~See if checks are needed for `autowrite` too.~ Maybe not?

7. ~Look at [this](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/actions/runs/15050770700/job/42304751396?pr=33953) ubuntu asan clang functionaltest error.~ Resolved in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/33953#issuecomment-2892791488

8. ~Add session management - ":mksession" on the server before sending off the RPC request and then starting the new server on that session file ~[would need to call another function instead of ui_client_start_server, it'd do the same thing but add the -S arg OR look at other alternatives for this]~ Seems like calling ui_client_start_server with a modified argv doesnt work. Similarly for trying to run ":source <session_file>" after the ui client attaches to the new server.~ Seems like so much of a chore because of the race conditions in the dispatch of ui_client_attach.
Maybe we could give users a autocmd hook `RestartPre` and `RestartPost` to run ":mksession" and ":source <session_file>" on their own? Or we could do that in the existing runtime as a default (need to discuss this).

9. ~Look at cases where there are tabs open and what happens when you ":restart" then. Ideally would need to disallow if any tab is unsaved.~ Works as expected and prevents ":restart" and allows ":restart!". 
~Restoring the state of these may be out of scope (especially as restoring session (TODO No. 6) doesn't seem like it's leading anywhere with as little code changes as possible at the moment).~ This is just a part of the TODO No. 6 at this point.

10. ~Refactor the functions where we get tui props `width`, `height`, `term` and `rgb` into a singular function called `ui_client_get_tui_props()` ? (I can't decide on this completely because get_tui_props would imply getting every available property as a Dict, i wonder if I can either name it better or just leave it be). Wonder if this refactor is necessary though.~ Resolved in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/33953#issuecomment-2892791488

Okay I will just put in all the things that need to be discussed here:
1. ~`RestartPre` and `RestartPost`  autocmd hooks for doing ":mksession" and ":source <session_file>" manually.
Did not find any good way to do this. RestartPre hook works. But having it also perform a RestartPost when the ui has not fully attached is causing some issues. Either that or ":source"ing a session file might not be the best way to restore a session. Moreover ":mksession" probably needs work before this can even be a thing.~ Discussed in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/33953#issuecomment-2929737027

2. ~The ubuntu asan clang functionaltest error which reports a TUI stopped (?) error constantly while running `test/functional/terminal`.
Findings:
`channel_close()` on a channel with `detach = false` does not force self-exit on close. This could cause the error? Maybe we can kill the process manually if it is still active.~ Turns out it was a silly memory leak 😅

3. ~Docs and wording 😬.~ Discussed as well.

4. ~Refactor the part where we get tui properties with `ui_client_get_width()`, `ui_client_get_height()`, `ui_client_get_term()` and `ui_client_get_rgb()` to be a singular function ( `ui_client_get_props()` ) that returns a `Dict` and we could just add some parsing logic for it in `nvim_restart()`.~ This is done.
With that I think I'll open it up for review while I try and fix the functionaltest error

> I would expect the normal `VimEnter`/`VimLeave` to work. I don't see why we would treat `:restart` specially? Maybe I'm wrong though.

Hmmm I would have to try this out....

`VimEnter`/`VimLeave` are working afaict, which isn't surprising since we are literally just starting a new `nvim` process. The open question is whether scripts need to know specifically that "restart" is happening. We could set a `v:event` field to indicate that.
That makes total sense... i'll do that right away

I suggest waiting on that until a followup PR. It shouldn't block this one. 

The only tiny blockers here are 

- https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/33953#discussion_r2119536946
- add a news.txt item

Added missing docs in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/34261 .
I also added a "Note:" for https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/33953#discussion_r2119588491. That'd be okay right?

> `VimEnter`/`VimLeave` are working afaict, which isn't surprising since we are literally just starting a new `nvim` process. The open question is whether scripts need to know specifically that "restart" is happening. We could set a `v:event` field to indicate that.

I would say that a way to distinguish "normal" and "restart" events would be useful. I see the main use case is to write temporary `:mksession` file on `VimLeave` and then reading/deleting it on `VimEnter`. Without distinguishing "normal" and "restart" this would always (not only on `:restart`) restore the same session.
